auth.sessionExpired: Your session has expired. Please sign in again.

drive.notFound: Google Drive item not found. Check the folder/file ID and access permissions.

sheets.notFound: Tank spreadsheet not found. Check that the file exists and that you’re signed in with the right Google account.
sheets.missingTab: Your tank spreadsheet is missing the “{sheet}” tab. Create it (or create a new tank) to continue.

home.heroDescription: A frontend-only aquarium logbook to capture tests, events, photos, and spot trends over time.

sprint1.title: Sprint 1
sprint1.description: Page skeletons + coherent navigation (with a mocked “active tank” selector).
bullets: All main routes exist: tanks, tests, photos, events, reminders, settings
Active tank selector is visible in the header (mock list)

tank.title: Tank
tank.description: This will become the main per-tank dashboard (latest values, alerts, charts, photos, and events).

sprint1.title: Sprint 1 skeleton
sprint1.descriptionPrefix: You’re viewing a mocked tank route:
bullets: Read real tanks from the user’s TankLog Drive folder (Sprint 4)
Bring together tests, ranges, and charts here (Sprint 6–9)

latest.title: Latest values
latest.description: Your most recent measurements and alerts for this tank.
latest.emptyHint: Add a water test to see latest values and alerts here.

events.description: Recent interventions and maintenance for this tank.
events.emptyHint: Add a water change, dosing, or maintenance event to build a history here.

unknown.title: Unknown tank
unknown.descriptionPrefix: We don’t recognize this tank id yet:
unknown.body: This tank wasn’t found in your TankLog folder. Go back to Home and pick a valid tank.

tankConfiguration.title: Configuration
tankConfiguration.description: Update tank info and manage the tank folder.

form.title: Tank info
form.description: These fields are stored in the TANK_INFO tab of tank_data.xlsx.

errors.invalidVolume: Enter a valid volume in liters.

danger.title: Danger zone
danger.description: Deleting a tank will remove its Drive folder (including tank_data.xlsx and photos).
danger.confirmDescription: This will move the tank folder (and everything inside) to Google Drive Trash.

tests.title: Water tests
tests.description: Log measurements, review history, and spot trends over time.
tests.comingDescription: In Sprint 1 we’re just building the page skeletons and navigation.
plannedBullets: Add a test (write to Google Sheets)

trends.title: Trends
trends.description: Select a parameter to see an accurate trend chart over time.

empty.noHistoryHint: Add your first test above to see trends here.
empty.noParameterData: No measurements for this parameter yet.

dialog.title: Add water test (placeholder)
dialog.description: This becomes the real form in Sprint 5. For now, it validates the Dialog primitive (focus, keyboard, escape to close).
dialog.body: Nothing is saved yet — TankLog remains frontend-only and user-controlled.

form.title: Add water test
form.description: Save one test session as multiple measurements (one row per parameter) in your tank sheet. Parameters and units come from PARAMETER_RANGES.
form.locked: Connect your TankLog Drive folder first.
form.noTanks: No tanks found. Create your first tank in Settings to start logging tests.

hints.date: Saved as an ISO timestamp in the sheet (UTC).
hints.tank: This test will be saved to the tank you opened.
hints.parameters: Fill only what you measured — empty fields are skipped. Parameters and units are taken from your parameter ranges.

history.title: History
history.description: Browse past test sessions and open details.
history.emptyHint: Add your first test above — it will appear here.

rangesEditor.title: Parameter ranges
rangesEditor.description: Edit optimal, acceptable, and critical ranges used for out-of-range highlighting and reference. They are saved in your tank sheet (PARAMETER_RANGES).

preset.title: Presets
preset.description: Start quickly from a preset and then fine-tune values for your tank.
preset.confirmDescription: This will replace the parameters in the editor. It won’t change your sheet until you press Save.
preset.note: Presets are starting points only. Always adjust based on livestock and husbandry.

table.title: Ranges
table.description: Each card lets you set min/max for optimal, acceptable, and critical ranges (leave a band blank to skip it).
table.caption: Editable table of parameter ranges
table.empty: No parameters yet. Add one or apply a preset.

validation.minOrMaxRequired: Set at least a min or max for {parameter}.

errors.fixErrors: Fix the highlighted issues before saving.

ranges.emptyHint: No parameter ranges configured yet. Fill the PARAMETER_RANGES tab in your tank sheet to enable parameter selection and alerts.

banner.title: Out of range ({count})
banner.description: These measurements are outside the configured ranges for this tank type.

detail.title: Water test details
detail.description: Open a test session to see all measurements.
detail.tableCaption: Measurements in this water test session

photos.title: Photos
photos.description: Upload photos to Google Drive and start building a visual timeline of tank progress.
photos.comingDescription: We’ll upload to Google Drive and store metadata in Google Sheets.
photos.locked: Connect your TankLog Drive folder first.

noTanks.title: No tanks yet
noTanks.description: No tanks found. Create your first tank in Settings to start uploading photos.

form.title: Upload photo
form.description: Upload a tank photo to Google Drive and save its metadata in the PHOTOS sheet for this tank.

hints.date: Saved as an ISO timestamp in the sheet (UTC).
hints.file: Choose an image file (JPG, PNG, WebP…).

success.saved: Photo uploaded and saved to Google Sheets.

list.title: Uploaded photos
list.description: Photos uploaded for this tank (from the PHOTOS sheet).
list.emptyHint: Upload your first photo above — it will appear here.

timeline.title: Timeline
timeline.description: Browse tank photos over time. Click a photo to open it full screen.

compare.title: Compare photos
compare.description: Compare two photos side-by-side or toggle between them.

events.title: Events
events.description: Track interventions like water changes, dosing, equipment swaps, and maintenance.
events.locked: Connect your TankLog Drive folder first.

noTanks.title: No tanks yet
noTanks.description: No tanks found. Create your first tank in Settings to start logging events.

form.title: Add event
form.description: Save an intervention as a single row in the EVENTS sheet for this tank.

hints.date: Saved as an ISO timestamp in the sheet (UTC).
hints.type: Choose what you did (water change, dosing, maintenance…).
hints.description: Keep it short and human (e.g. “20% water change”, “Cleaned skimmer”).
hints.quantity: Optional. Use with a unit when relevant (e.g. 20 L, 5 ml).

list.title: History
list.description: Browse past events for this tank.
list.emptyHint: Add your first event above — it will appear here.

events.comingDescription: Events will be stored in the user’s Google Sheet.

reminders.title: Reminders
reminders.description: Track tasks (water changes, dosing, maintenance) and see what’s upcoming or overdue.
reminders.locked: Connect your TankLog Drive folder first.

noTanks.title: No tanks yet
noTanks.description: No tanks found. Create your first tank in Settings to start using reminders.

form.title: Add reminder
form.description: Save a task as a single row in the REMINDERS sheet for this tank.

hints.nextDue: Saved as an ISO timestamp in the sheet (UTC).

errors.missingNextDue: Pick a due date and time.
errors.invalidRepeatEveryDays: Enter a whole number of days > 0.

list.title: Upcoming & overdue
list.emptyHint: Add your first reminder above — it will appear here.

settings.title: Settings
settings.description: Account, language, and TankLog storage live here.

onboarding.title: Getting started
onboarding.description: Follow these steps to set up TankLog in a few minutes.

template.hint: If you’re connecting an existing tank spreadsheet, make sure it contains these tabs (TankLog creates them automatically for new tanks).

storage.title: Connect your TankLog folder
storage.description: Connect the TankLog folder in Google Drive (paste the link/ID, search for it, or create it).

tanks.title: Create your first tank
tanks.description: TankLog will create the Drive folder structure and initialize tank_data.xlsx with the required sheets.

next.title: Start logging
next.description: Add water tests, events, photos, and reminders.
next.noTanks: No tanks found yet — create one above to continue.

language.title: Language
language.description: Choose the language for the UI.

storage.title: Storage (Google Drive)
storage.description: Select your TankLog folder in Google Drive. Until it’s connected, the rest of the app is locked.
storage.label: TankLog folder ID or URL
storage.hint: Paste the TankLog folder link/ID. You can also search for existing “TankLog” folders or create one.

createDialog.title: Create TankLog folder
createDialog.description: TankLog will create a “TankLog” folder in your Drive root. You can move it later if you want.

errors.invalidFolder: Enter a valid Google Drive folder ID or URL.
errors.noFoldersFound: No “TankLog” folders found in your Drive.
errors.createFailed: Failed to create the TankLog folder.

tanks.title: Tanks
tanks.description: Create tanks (Drive folder + per-tank spreadsheet) and select the active one.
tanks.locked: Connect your TankLog Drive folder first.
tanks.listHint: Tanks are discovered from Drive folders inside TankLog.
tanks.empty: No tanks found. Create your first tank to get started.

createDialog.title: Add a new tank
createDialog.description: TankLog will create the tank folder structure and initialize tank_data.xlsx with the required sheets.

errors.invalidVolume: Enter a valid volume in liters.

reset.title: Reset
reset.description: Clear TankLog’s local settings from this device. This does not delete anything from Google Drive or Sheets.
reset.confirmDescription: This will disconnect the TankLog folder and clear the active tank from this device. Your data in Google Drive/Sheets will not be deleted.

login.title: Sign in
login.description: TankLog uses Google to access your own Google Sheets + Drive (no backend, no proprietary DB).
login.cardDescription: We’ll request access to Sheets and Drive (folder discovery + files created by TankLog).

errors.missingClientId: Missing Google Client ID. Set NUXT_PUBLIC_GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID and reload.

login.sessionNote: Session is stored in this browser tab (session storage).
